head.supplied: ¶ According to verbal arrangements at the Under Secretary's Office this was agreed to some months ago, and I now beg to submit this account for the favorable consideration of the honorable the Chief ...

div.p: 88/R9821, unit 1226, VPRS 1207/P000 inward registered correspondence, VA 865 Department of the Treasurer, Public Record Office, Victoria.

According to verbal arrangements at the Under Secretary's Office this was agreed to some months ago, and I now beg to submit this account for the favorable consideration of the honorable the Chief Secretary.
An account of £190 for printing the seventh edition of Select Extra Tropical Plants (B88.12.01) was submitted by the Government Printermarked 'very urgent'and referred by H. Moors to M'for early attention'' on 22 August 1888. The printing had been approved previously; see M to Alfred Deakin, 19 March 1888(in this edition as 88-03-19a). The letter is marked: 'Account approved and returned H. Moors for U. Sec. CSO 23/8/88'.
